com.google.appinventor.components.runtime

Class NxtColorSensor

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.google.appinventor.components.runtime.AndroidNonvisibleComponent
      • com.google.appinventor.components.runtime.LegoMindstormsNxtBase
        • com.google.appinventor.components.runtime.LegoMindstormsNxtSensor
          • com.google.appinventor.components.runtime.NxtColorSensor
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    BluetoothConnectionListener, Component, Deleteable

    public class NxtColorSensor
extends LegoMindstormsNxtSensor
implements Deleteable
    A component that provides a high-level interface to a color sensor on a LEGO MINDSTORMS NXT robot.
    Author:
    lizlooney@google.com (Liz Looney)

      • SensorPort

        Specified by:
        SensorPort in class LegoMindstormsNxtSensor

      • DetectColor

        public boolean DetectColor()
        Returns whether the sensor should detect color or light. True indicates that the sensor should detect color; False indicates that the sensor should detect light. The ColorChanged event will not occur if the DetectColor property is set to False. The BelowRange, WithinRange, and AboveRange events will not occur if the DetectColor property is set to True. The sensor will not generate color when the DetectColor property is set to True.

      • DetectColor

        public void DetectColor(boolean detectColor)
        Specifies whether the sensor should detect color light. True indicates that the sensor should detect color; False indicates that the sensor should detect light.

      • GetColor

        public int GetColor()

      • ColorChangedEventEnabled

        public boolean ColorChangedEventEnabled()
        Returns whether the ColorChanged event should fire when the DetectColor property is set to True and the detected color changes.

      • ColorChangedEventEnabled

        public void ColorChangedEventEnabled(boolean enabled)
        Specifies whether the ColorChanged event should fire when the DetectColor property is set to True and the detected color changes

      • AboveRange

        public void AboveRange()

      • GenerateColor

        public int GenerateColor()
        Returns the color that should generated by the sensor. Only None, Red, Green, or Blue are valid values. The sensor will not generate color when the DetectColor property is set to True.

      • GenerateColor

        public void GenerateColor(int generateColor)
        Specifies the color that should generated by the sensor. Only None, Red, Green, or Blue are valid values. The sensor will not generate color when the DetectColor property is set to True.
